reviewText: The main feature, a televised performance for Australian TV is just OK, with Peter & the Band looking bored or even annoyed through most of the show (someone had the bright idea to give the audience paper streamers to throw, and the stage soon becomes ankle deep in them). There are quality issues with the film, with some scratches apparent, but an otherwise sharp image.The real excitement is the bonus features- 4 songs performed live on the German TV show "Beat Beat Beat", 5 songs lip-synced on Norwegian TV, plus clips from both HH movies. "Leaning on a Lamp post" sung in outer space?The "2007 edit" of the Hilton show,  with all sorts of "pop up video" special effects, is useless, unless you were going to play it in the background at a party or something.I can recommend this video to Herman's Hermits fans without reservation!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Here's the 'feel-good' DVD of the year. This is a trip back to 1966 with one of the world's most popular groups. Yes, Herman's Hermits were selling singles like hotcakes back then. I believe they sold more singles in 1965 than The Beatles. Anyway, the main attraction of this DVD is the Hilton Show. Bearing in mind that it's a 43 year old black and white TV special, it is emminently watchable and the group is in fine form, playing their hits with gusto and including a couple of other gems, like "Jezebel" (which beats the studio version by a mile) and an excellent run-through of Chuck Berry's "I'm Talkin' Bout You" which to my ears beats the better-known cover versions by their fellow British Invaders The Rolling Stones and The Hollies. Complete with commercials for a nylon company (lots of leggy girls), this is a fun watch. Add the live German TV performances and you get a good idea how good a band The Hermits were. They were excellent players and highly underrated. The studio recordings are one thing, but here's the real deal; Herman's Hermits Live at the peak of their popularity. Something good indeed.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I don't want to discourage anyone from buying this. It is ok for the quality. I loved these guys when I was a young kid. There is a bunch of young girls with pom poms and confetti. They keep throwing it at  the poor singer while he is on stage. He looks good and the songs are fine. It was a bad job by the folks that put it on. I think it was a quick last minute set up.  I think Herman's Hermits deserved a better layout. If you like the songs and the group, then buy it just to see them. Wish it could have been an Ed Sullivan show because these fellows deserved better as performers.Herb Salisbury
summary: Live at the Hilton is ok
Title: N/A

reviewText: Having seen Herman's Hermits in concert in 1966 I got this mainly to bring back memories - and it did.  As someone else has pointed out, the group was a lot more musically tight than they were ever given credit for.  Loads of fun watching this half-hour concert - but if you want to watch the concert, watch the 1966 version, not the 2007 update which for some reason, the makers of the dvd decided should be done more as a comic book/music video.  The update version gives you very little feel of the actual concert - that's what you get with the original.  And, to top it off, you get the actual commercials as well which are priceless!  Added bonuses include a complete 15-minute lip synched TV concert appearance in Norway which, despite the lip-synching is enjoyable to watch.  Ditto the German TV appearance.  I would give it 5 stars except for the music video feel of the 2007 Update and the way they mucked up one of the extras, the Herman's Hermits Story - video quality on that leaves much to be desired.  Overall though, an enjoyable trip down memory lane.

reviewText: Not one of my favorites by these guys.But,a great collectors Item!I still recommend it for those of you who came up on these guys.

reviewText: Not easy to come across rare Herman's Hermits videos and actually LIVE to boot! I could have done without the cheesy 2007 video remix but just select original format on the menu and watch the concert as it was originally broadcast... the Extras are great also... This video showcases how good the band was live!...If you're a true blue Herman's Hermits fan then this video is a must... not to avoid...

reviewText: After reading all of the negative reviews of this disc, I should make you aware that the "Hilton Special" Australian concert performance is available elsewhere, and with pristine video quality(from the original video masters) on a new DVD "Herman's Hermits-Listen People", a disc created with the cooperation of the group's four surviving members.
